result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact), received and filed.

Defendant Eric M Evans in court with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  
Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final Pre-trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

On oral motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 AMENDED to: THEFT (VALUE NOT EXCEEDING $2,500)- PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a), and (3)(a), 939.51 (3)(a), 939.05, a Class A Misdemeanor

AS TO COUNT 1 AND COUNT 2 (AS AMENDED):  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.   Jury Trial date of 1-13-16 CONVERTED to sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
filed by the state.
State's Motion in Limine, filed.
State's Witness List, filed.
Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact), received and filed.

Defendant Eric M Evans in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Status Conference.  Stipulated request for new court date, received and filed.  A final pretrial conference date is set for November 23, 2015 at 8:30am and a Jury Trial date set for January 13, 2016 at 9:00am both in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Eric M Evans in court with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.

Matter adjourned for a status conference on September 24, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Eric M Evans in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for status of counsel hearing.
Atty. Andrew Golden is now the attorney of record for the defendant.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 08-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Status Conference.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Missed office contact.)

Defendant Eric M Evans in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Stewart moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant due to a conflict of interest.
No objections.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Stewart to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
Atty. Alexis Stewart is now discharged.
Atty. Stewart is to ensure that new counsel is appointed by the next court date.

Case adjourned to 07-23-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Eric M Evans in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 6/9/15.
css

Defendant Eric M Evans in court.  Jeremy Arn for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Stewart contacted court at approximately 9:25 a.m. stating that she would not be available to appear for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Potawatomi Casino, Alyssa B; Amy R; Co-Defendant: Avashon Gray.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eric M Evans in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Eric M Evans in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty as to Count 2.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
